B cost_function module =====================

Different cost functions for VQE and one abstract template.

class vqe.cost_function.AbstractCostFunction(return_standard_deviation=False, log=None)¶

Bases: object

Template class for cost_functions that are passed to the optimizer.

class vqe.cost_function.PrepareAndMeasureOnQVM(prepare_ansatz, make_memory_map, hamiltonian, qvm, return_standard_deviation=False, base_numshots=100, qubit_mapping=None, log=None)¶

Bases: vqe.cost_function.AbstractCostFunction

A cost function that prepares an ansatz and measures its energy w.r.t hamiltonian on a quantum computer (or simulator).

This cost_function makes use of pyquils parametric circuits and thus has to be supplied with a parametric circuit and a function to create memory maps that can be passed to qvm.run.

Warning

For now this works only with hamiltonians diagonal in the computational basis!

class vqe.cost_function.PrepareAndMeasureOnWFSim(prepare_ansatz, make_memory_map, hamiltonian, sim, return_standard_deviation=False, noisy=False, log=None, qubit_mapping=None)¶

Bases: vqe.cost_function.AbstractCostFunction

A cost function that prepares an ansatz and measures its energy w.r.t hamiltonian on the qvm

vqe.cost_function.address_qubits_hamiltonian(hamiltonian, qubit_mapping)¶

Map Qubit Placeholders to ints in a PauliSum.

Parameters

  • hamiltonian (PauliSum) – The PauliSum.

  • qubit_mapping (Dict[QubitPlaceholder, Union[Qubit, int]]) – A qubit_mapping. e.g. provided by pyquil.quil.get_default_qubit_mapping.

Returns

A PauliSum with remapped Qubits.

Return type

PauliSum

Note

This code relies completely on going all the way down the rabbits hole with for loops. It would be preferable to have this functionality in pyquil.paulis.PauliSum directly

Return type

PauliSum
